reviews.review_msg: Uwe is very knowledgeable about cybersecurity, but what is taught in class is more the theoretical side of cybersecurity. Uwe is probably cybersecurity Fortinet HHM anomalies haha

Phenomenal professor who adeptly carries out an effective and cohesive approach in conveying a productive and coherent lecture during every class. Despite limited availability due to conference engagements and research commitments, it does not undermine his capacity to impart a sense of enjoyment in an advanced computer science course.
bro reset his rate my prof bruhhhh

Uwe is extremely helpful both in class and in office hours. He has a passion for cybersecurity and wants everyone in his class to succeed. Sometimes he will go on tangents in lecture, but overall he covers the course material well. His assignments are relevant to the course and explained well. Great professor and great person.

Most of this course is based on group project, 30% Tests, Uwe is Knowledegble and will respond to questions really fast and I would recommend him to anyone intrested in field of cybersecurity and Machine learning.

I don't think the school lets Uwe teach students how to hack in the traditional sense... which is fair. So, Uwe has to instead teach anomaly detection which doesn't sound as fun. And it isn't. The course was a bit disorganised, and I felt we crammed everything into the last month. Also, Uwe is also a slow talker and often digresses.

Course is same as CMPT 310 (AI) but with more writing. Easy course with lots of group work. Class material has little connection to assignments. Only need to go to tutorials for solutions to assignments and exams. Assignments marked very slowly. Assignments use R. Tests are on slide memorization. Slow talker.

Glaesser is very knowledgeable and has plenty of background information and experience when it comes to teaching Cybersecurity, but perhaps one of the laziest profs in the faculty!!! Everyone gets 5/5 on his attendance marking criteria and the fact that he demands so much for the project while returning no assignment or midterm grades is ridiculous
Cmpt318 should be called intro to stats and Markov models. Boring lecture

He is one of the worst professors I've had: the class material is disorganized and has little to no links with assignments; extremely dry and incoherent lectures; and test & assignment feedback takes forever. The way he teaches the course makes it a pure-memorization course and you'll do well if you fully memorize his slides.

I had a decent experience with CMPT318: Cybersecurity class. Don't let the name fool you, the class is more about big data analysis and statistics than cybersecurity. The workload was very low, but if you have a bad group you will have to write 25 pages of report by yourself. The class material was disorganized, but Uwe clearly knows his stuff.
pretty interesting course.  not much covered, and it's pretty easy too if you know the basics.  the e-commerce stuff was barely tested on the final though...
